title: Kinetic energy - ranking for different directions

content.question: In four different scenarios, a ball is rolled or thrown from the top of a building at the same speed in different directions as shown. In Scenario <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> the ball is rolled across the roof of the building and in scenarios <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> the ball is thrown in the directions indicated. Taking right and towards the top of the page to be positive for the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>- and <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-directions respectively, which of the following correctly ranks the initial kinetic energies of the ball <math alttext="K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="K sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="K sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="K sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, in the four scenarios <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub A is less than K sub B, equals K sub C, which equals K sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub A is less than K sub B, equals K sub D is less than K sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub D is less than K sub A, equals K sub C, which is less than K sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub A equals K sub B, which equals K sub C, which equals K sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub A equals K sub B, which equals K sub C, which equals K sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
